item.description:
Come join me for a 4 1/2 mile loop hike around Tully Lake. This is a moderate hike which takes approximately 2 hours to complete depending on speed of hikers and length of stop for photo ops at the falls. Doane's Falls is along the trail at the 2 mile marker and has some moderately steep areas but worth it with the lovely views of the falls along the Lawrence River.

There is more hiking available to people who'd like to do more on parts of the 22 mile Tully Trail or the 7.5 mile Long Pond Trail.

Don't forget to bring your towel if you want to jump in the lake after the hike;-)! Although you must watch out for all those crazy kayakers on the weekends;-).

There is also a very nice picnic area if you want to bring your cooler lunch and enjoy. Adult beverages are allowed but if you do enjoy, please be responsible.

The directions are to the headquarters which is just a few feet south of the actual recreational area across the bridge where the dam is.

Please just park where you can, preferably upper parking lot and meet at lower parking area near the large map at 9am with all our gear and ready to hike.

I drive a maroon 2003 Monte Carlo. Not always early.

Please note: Anything other than light rain cancels this hike. Please check the site the morning of the hike if we have questionable weather. I will announce by 7-7:30am if we have to cancel due to weather conditions.

Also if we do have to cancel, we will have a rain date of Saturday, September 1st or 8th for those who can make it. We'll take a vote on that rain date.

Ponchos can be purchased very inexpensively, available in hunting or camping section of stores and are great to have in your pack.

New weather update: We may need a last minute time change or rain date. The National Weather Service forecast for tomorrow morning is a 50% chance of thunderstorms before 1pm and a slight chance between 1-2 pm. We can do this in the afternoon after 2pm tomorrow or move it to a rain date, maybe September 1st or Sept 8th?
Would love to know what works for people. Please let me know if you see this comment.
This forecast is for Athol which is bordering Royalston on the south side.
http://forecast.weather.gov/Map...

Will check weather again in the morning and post by 7-7:30am. Would rather not cancel unless we must.

Good news!!!!!! Yippee! Doing a celebration dance here!;-)We are still on for today....


The updated weather forecast is looking much better as the rain is only expected before 9am this morning then a gradual clearing.


http://forecast.weather.gov/Map...


Today Showers likely, mainly before 9am. Patchy fog before 10am. Otherwise, cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly sunny, with a high near 80. Calm wind becoming northwest around 6 mph in the afternoon. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New precipitation amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

Â 

If you are running late or can't find us, please call me at 413.559.0192

Photo: Tully Lake Recreation Area

Photo: Tully Lake Recreation Area
Tully Lake Recreation Area

2 Athol-Richmond Rd.(rt 32), Royalston, MA
978-249-9150

Paddle among dozens of islands on this spectacular lake. To the northeast follow the narrow Tully River to Long Pond for excellent wildlife viewing. Cartop boat access also available on Doane Hill Rd.
Description:

Tully Lake Recreation Area protects about four miles of the Tully River, including Long Pond, where the river widens, and the 200-acre Tully Lake, created by a flood-control dam. The wetlands and the forest support a wide variety of flora and fauna, lists of which are available online. The land and the lake offer numerous recreational opportunities, including camping, picnicking, boating, fishing, and hiking. A one-mile interpretive trail introduces visitors to both natural and cultural history; another trail loops around the lake and connects to scenic vistas and waterfalls. Part of this loop constitutes one leg of the Tully Trail.

Directions:

From Rte. 2 take Exit 17 (Rte. 32N) and follow Rte 32 signs closely for about 6 miles to entrance, just past dam, on right.

http://goo.gl/maps/XNTPY


Contact:

U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
Tully Lake Park Office
2 Athol-Richmond Road(rt 32)
Royalston, MA 01368
